data.title: Obituaries
data.text:
KATIE LOU ALLEN

Katie passed away at Bethany Home in Ripon, CA after a long illness. She was a long time resident of San Leandro, CA, and had moved to Hilmar, CA in 1993 to be close to her brothers and sisters. Her husband, Eldon W. Allen, a retired Navy Chief, had preceded her in death years earlier. Katie was an avid bowler frequenting Manor Bowl and the State Championships. She enjoyed playing golf and traveling with her friends; The Golf Nutts, and champion Donald Sterne. Camping was another passion and family tradition. From the inland lakes to the mountain streams, she enjoyed fishing, boating, and the company of family and friends. Katie is survived by two of her four sons; Steven and Robert and several grandchildren. We will truly miss her. God Bless. There will be no services; private burial at Lakewood Memorial, Empire, CA.

ADELA H. BONNER

RESIDENT OF LIVERMORE

Adela Bonner was born February 4, 1922 in Ripon, CA, and entered into rest March 10, 2008.

Adela enjoyed traveling, bird watching, flower watching, and was a nature enthusiast. She especially loved Yosemite. She met with a stitchery group for 40 years, consisting of some of her closest friends. She was a volunteer dorm mother at Parks Job Core Center and was George Foreman’s dorm mother. She was one of the original members of the league of Women voters in Livermore. Adela was know as a very intelligent women, having graduated from UC Berkley in 1942, receiving a BA, Goddard University, receiving an MA, and Cal State Hayward, receiving an MS. She was a member of Phi Beta Capa while attending Berkley, and worked as a marriage counselor for 5 years. She was also fluent in 3 foreign languages.

Adela is survived by her husband of 62 years, Norman Bonner; Daughter and son-in-law Elenor and Richard Anderson of Santa Cruz, and “adopted” daughter Rachel Fatoohi of Coopertino.

A Memorial Service will be held at the family residence Sunday, March 16, 2:30pm.

Contributions can be made to the Nature Conservancy or Hope Hospice. CALLAGHAN MORTUARY

3833 EAST AVE. LIVERMORE

925-447-2942

ELVIRA J. BUTI

Elvira J. Buti, aged 92, spent 90 of her years living in Castro Valley, CA. She was born in her family home located in Castro Valley on April 8, 1915, and died peacefully on March 11, 2008. She claims she had a date with an “angel”, her loving husband of 67 years, Armano Remo Buti, who preceded her in death in 2004. She is survived by her beloved son, Raymond M. Buti; grandchildren, Raymond M. Buti, Jr., and Renee Buti-Wallis; great grandchild Zachary Scott Wallis, all of Castro Valley. She had one sister, Ferdinanda Korge, who preceded her in death in 2000. Elvira spent her years as a devoted wife, sister, mother and grandmother and lived for her Italian cooking, hobbies and crafts, especially crocheting. She actively created her works of art until weeks before her death. She delighted in giving to others, especially her beautiful crafts, all of which will be treasured in her memory. Elvira had a great love for and many fond memories of Bodega Bay and Lake Tahoe where she and her husband spent many good times together. Wonderful memories will linger in the hearts of those who knew and experienced Elvira’s greatest attributes; a sense of humor and laughter. Services will be private at Holy Sepulchre Cemetery in Hayward. Donations in Elvira’s memory may be made to the American Heart Association, 1710 Gilbreth Rd., Burlingame, CA 94010 or the American Diabetes Association, P.O. Box 2680 North Canton,OH 44720.

Susie Chew Sin Choy

October 21, 1931 – March 8, 2008

Susie Chew Sin Choy, a long time Fremont resident, passed away Saturday, March 8. All her family was by her side. A native of Canton, China. She came to America in 1949 with her late husband, Jimmy. Together, with other family members, they operated Mission Way Market in Irvington. More recently, she was a homemaker enjoying all of her grandchildren, working in the yard, knitting and ceramics.

She leaves behind 4 children, Diana Kennedy, Shirley Won (Richard), Danny Choy (Betty) all of Fremont. Linda Barros (Ken) of Livermore, sister-in-law Jean Wan (Harry), Niece Lori Wan-Lim (Ray), nephew Keith Wan (Deanna) all of San Diego and seven grand-children.

Friends & family are invited to attend a funeral service on Saturday, March 15, at 10:00am at Albert Brown Mortuary 3476 Piedmont Ave. Oakland. Burial will follow at Mountain View Cemetery in Piedmont. Visitation is Friday to 8:00pm

ROSE GIRARD (FEDORUK)

JANUARY 12, 1928 – MARCH 7, 2008

Rose Girard passed away on Friday, March 7, 2008, comforted by family and friends at her side. She was preceded in death by her daughter Pamela Rose (Girard) Brandon and grand-daughter Cassie Jean Girard.

Rose is survived by loving husband Rodney C. Girard of Fremont, loving mother to son Richard M. Girard and wife, Tina, of Mokelumne Hill, CA, and daughter Gloryanne H. (Girard) Bryant and husband, Nathaniel, of Fremont. Grandmother to Sherea N. A. Westra and husband, Keith of Fremont, and Nathan D.E. Bryant of Buckeye, AZ. Great Grandmother to Keira Kathryn Rose Westra.

Rose was a sister to Nettie Fedoruk, John Fedoruk, Gordon Fedoruk and Linda Symynuk of British Columbia. Sister-in-law to Rita Herberts of Vancouver, B.C. Canada. Rose was an Aunt and Great Aunt to many nieces and nephews.

Rose worked for many years at the San Mateo Medical Clinic as the Office manager and later for a physician office practice. Annually, Rose would host a “Swim Party” at their home for family and friends until she retired. She enjoyed gardening, loved flowers, sewing, and cooking. She had a passion for collecting teapots, Ukrainian eggs and traveling. She was a native of Alberta, Canada and lived in the U.S. since 1961, living 2 years in San Mateo. Rose was a Fremont resident since 1963 and married to her husband Rod for 58 years.

Family and friends are invited to attend a Memorial Service on Thursday, March 13 at 4:00pm at St. James Episcopal Church 37051 Cabrillo Drive, Fremont, CA.

In lieu of flowers, the family requested donations be made in her name to the Salvation Army or the American Heart Assoc.

Sumiko Hatakeda

December 21, 1918 – March 4, 2008

Born in Oakland, later moving to San Leandro where she lived for over 60 years. Predeceased by husband Shigeo, daughter Gail Grant, and grandson Dennis Hatakeda. Survived by children Helene (Nob) Iwasa, Harold Hatakeda, Marian (Bob) Chambers, Bruce (Donna) Hatakeda, and Leslie Hatakeda; grandchildren Terry (Jaydee) Dearing, Katherine (Tom) McDonald, John Chambers, Randy and Jeffrey Hatakeda; great grandchildren John and Heather Dearing, and Deborah McDonald. Also survived by brothers Jive (Betty), Tad (Kimi) and Aki (Yone) Asai. Leaves behind many nieces and nephews. Visitation Friday, March 14, 2008 at 4:30 to 8:30 pm at Chapel of the Chimes, 32992 Mission Blvd., Hayward (510) 471-3363. Service on Saturday, March 15, 2008 at Fremont Memorial Chapel Mortuary, 3723 Peralta Blvd., Fremont (510) 793-8900. Visitation from 12:30pm – Service at 1:30pm.

Oliver Theodore Jones passed away March 2, 2008 in Marysville, CA from heart failure at the age of 71. Ted Jones was born August 26, 1936, the youngest son of Betty & John T. Jones. He was a native of Kansas. His early years were spent on the family farm near Frankfort, KS. He graduated from Frankfort High School in 1954. He joined the U.S. Navy in 1954 & served as a corpman, x-ray technician & x-ray repairman.

He married Carol Clark in 1956. They were married for 25 years. Their son Doug was born January 1958.

After the Navy, Ted worked for Kaiser Permanente & then went into the equipment rental business in 1972 at Centerville Rents in Fremont. He started Mission Valley Rentals in 1976 & operated it until 1984 He also started a rock company.

He married Dolores Evans September 3, 1983.

After selling his rental business, he moved to Marysville, CA & purchased a ranch & lived there the remainder of his life. He raised cattle & had a large variety of animals. He loved the ranch life. He once said that his best accomplishment was learning to train cattle dogs. He started a rental company in Marysville & operated it for 3 years.

Ted was always a dedicated family man. He will be remembered for his great sense of humor. He spent his life laughing & joking with his family & friends.

He leaves his wife Dolores, his son Douglas Jones, Ft. Lauderdale, FL; five step-children, Matt & Gloria Evans of Los Angeles, CA; Terry Trujillo of El Dorado Hills, CA; Paula Hill-Ott of Chico, CA; Deana & Ken Hugen of Tracy, CA; and John & Cheryl Evans of Lodi, CA; eleven step-grandchildren: Madison Evans, Katy & Aaron Trujillo, Autumn Hill, Jessica, Tina & Seth Ott, Harry & Leland Evans, Christopher & Olivia Hugen & his brother Jack Jones of Missouri.

He was preceded in death by his mother Betty Jones, his father John T. Jones and his sister Jane Tilley.

A memorial service will be held Saturday, March 15 at 11:00am at Ullray Memorial Temple, 817 Almond St., Yuba City, CA

JACK C. KELLY

Reunited with his parents, brother Don and brother Red. Jack as born in Oakland, CA. He grew up and attended school there until he was called to serve his country. Jack served in both the USCG/Merchant Marine and U.S. Army. While defending his country he received the Atlantic War Zone Medal and the Pacific War Zone Medal. While in the Army, Jack received the WWII Victory Medal, and Army of Occupation Medal Japan. Jack was an auto mechanic for many years before retiring in the 80’s. Survived by many family and friends who will miss him dearly. Grave side services will be held at Chapel of the Chimes. Friday, March 14, 2008, at 1:00 pm, 32992 Mission Blvd., Hayward, CA 94544 (510) 471-3363.

KATHLEEN K. LENNON

Kathleen K. Lennon entered peacefully into rest on Friday, February 29, 2008 in Washington Hospital, Fremont, California surrounded by her loving family. Although she had many months of suffering her end came quickly and peacefully.

Kathleen K. Currie was born on March 12, 1922 in Glasgow, Scotland and married her childhood friend John Lennon with whom she delivered four children. The first, a girl, died at birth but they successfully raised the others John, Margaret and James. After many tough years in Scotland her husband of many years passed away suddenly from heart failure in 1988. After this she moved to live in California and for the past thirteen years was a resident of the Newark Gardens 2 apartments where she had many friends.

Kathleen will be cremated and then have a memorial service in St. Edward Church at 5788 Thornton Avenue in Newark, on Saturday, March 15 at 10:30 a.m. The children of Kathleen extend an invitation to all her friends to attend the mass and then following the mass to gather in the adjoining church hall and share your memories. Refreshments will be provided by the family.

HANSENA PATRICIA LLOYD

Of Fremont, entered into heaven on March 8,2 008 at the age of 84. Loving mother to Lisa and Jerry Martin of West Virginia, Ray and Carolyn Lloyd of Fremont, and Carla and Gregory Carvalho of Fremont. Devoted grandmother to Stephanie, Scott, Olivia, Jordan, and Brayden. Dear sister to Jim Perry,Dave “Bill” Perry, and Tresa Guercio.

Born March 27, 1923 in Oakland, Hansena enjoyed oil painting, sewing, and playing her piano. She loved singing and was very creative. In her younger years she enjoyed her work at the Richmond Independent and Post Enquire Newspapers.

A grave side service will be held Friday, March 14, 2008 at 2:00 pm at Irvington Memorial Cemetery, 41001 Chapel Way,Fremont, CA 94538.

In lieu of flowers, please make donations to St. Anthony’s Dinning Room in Oakland. Fremont Chapel of the Roses

ARDITH MAY MARTINEZ

Ardith May Martinez passed away peacefully on Sunday March 9, 2008 at her home in San Leandro. Ardie was born on August 8, 1948 in San Leandro. She enjoyed spending holidays with family. She loved camping, cruises, gaming casinos and hanging out at Shooters. Ardie is survived by her husband of 24 years, Richard Martinez, sons, Chris and Jesse Bisi, stepdaughters Jackie and Renee Martinez and 10 grandchildren. Ardie was preceded in death by her mother Evelyn Weaving, her son Danny Bisi and her best friend Bunny. A memorial service celebrating her life will be held on Saturday, March 15, 2008 at 1:00 pm at Santos-Robinson Mortuary , 160 Estudillo Ave., San Leandro, CA. Santos-Robinson Mortuary

San Leandro (510) 483-0123

BARBARA O’SULLIVAN MAYNARD

October 26, 1937 – March 5, 2008

Barbara was born and raised in Oakland and graduated from Holy Names College in 1959. Barbara retired from Alameda County in 2000, as a Superior Court Clerk. She spent her retirement years in Castro Valley, and was always active with her many friends and her cousin, Geraldine Toler and her family.

Barbara is preceded in death by her husband, John Maynard; her parents, Stanley & Josephine O’Sullivan, and her brother, Michael O’Sullivan. She is survived by her brother Dennis (Diana) O’Sullivan; nephews Kevin (Chrissy) O’Sullivan and Brian (Joanne) O’Sullivan; niece Denise (Rick) Delamain; cousins Geraldine (Gerald) Toler and Beverly (Roger) Davis and nine great-nieces and great-nephews.

A memorial mass will be celebrated Friday, March 14th, 10:00 a.m. at Our Lady of Grace Church, 3433 Somerset Ave., Castro Valley. Inurnment will follow at a later date at Holy Sepulchre Cemetery, Hayward.

In lieu of flowers, the family suggests donations to The American Cancer Society, 1700 Webster St., Oakland, CA 94612/www.cancer.org, in Barbara’s memory. Holy Angels Funeral

& Cremation Center

(510)223-1265

LOUISE SMITH

A native of Oakland and resident of San Leandro for over 50 years passed away March11, 2008 after a long illness. Louise was preceded in death by her adored son, Greg Smith, her parents Manual and Belmira Souza, her dear brother Earl Souza and sister Margaret Steffan. She is survived by her loving husband of 59 years Carl “Keith” Smith, daughter Kim Serna (Patrick), grandchildren Dyami Serna (Tammy), Andrea Pool (Josh) and Rebecca Serna. Louise also leaves behind her adored great grandchildren Esme and Owen Pool, her loving sister Marie Larsen, a cousin Marlene Kilroy and many nieces and nephews.

Visitation will be at Guerrero Mortuary, 407 Estudillo Ave., San Leandro, Thursday, March 13th from 6-8:30 PM with a vigil at 7:00 PM. Graveside services will be on Friday March 14 at 10:00 AM at Holy Sepulchre Cemetery, 26320 Mission Blvd., Hayward, CA. GUERRERO MORTUARY

(510)483-5300

JACK HAROLD TARMAN

February 28, 1926 March 10, 2008

Jack Tarman passed away on March 10, 2008 in Walnut Creek at the age of 82. A native of Oakland, California, Jack was a graduate of Piedmont High School, where he ran track. After serving his country in the U.S. Army, Jack graduated from the University of California, Berkeley in 1950 and then joined his father as a real estate broker in the firm J.H. Tarman Co. in Oakland. Jack married his wife, Denise, in 1951 and remained her faithful and loving partner until her death in 1996. While raising their family of six children, Jack served as a friend, advisor and mentor to many within the Oakland business community. Over the past 20 years, he expanded the family real estate brokerage in proud partnership with his son, Kent Tarman. While residing over the past 16 years in Walnut Creek, Jack’s passions included gardening, tennis, travel, his pets and, most of all, generous support of his church and numerous charitable causes. Although faced with many life challenges, Jack’s ever-present faith and trust in God always served as his light, hope and salvation.

Jack is survived by his children John, Kimberly, Lisa, Timothy and Kent, his daughter-in-law Domini and his grandchildren Aimee and Brandon.

Friends and family are invited to a Celebration of Life Service on Friday, March 14, 2008 at 10:00am. at Oak Park Hills Chapel, 3111 N. Main Street, Walnut Creek.

The family requests donations to The Animal Rescue Foundation, 2890 Mitchell Drive, Walnut Creek, CA, 94598, or Project Hope, 255 Carter Hall Lane, Millwood, VA, 22646. OAK PARK HILLS CHAPEL

(925) 934-6500

JESSE CARROL WALLACE

Of Union City, entered into rest on March 6, 2008 at the age of 81. Predeceased by a child, Elaine Chappelle, in 1985. Beloved father to Julie Thacker of Bay Point, Carolyn Brading of Hayward, David Wallace of NV, and Gary Wallace of San Lorenzo. Treasured grandfather to David, Michael, Shannon, James, and Christine. Survived by 7 great-grandchildren. Dear brother to Altabea, Edith, Fern, and Alice Faye. Also survived by many nieces and nephews.

Born January 5, 1927 in Shamrock, TX, Jesse was a member of the Carpenters Union 713 of Hayward. He was always a loyal friend and helping hand to all who knew him. He will be truly missed by all who loved him.

Visitation Saturday, March 15, from 12-2pm at Fremont Chapel of the Roses, 1940 Peralta Blvd., Fremont, CA 94536. with a Chapel Service 2pm at the mortuary. Private Burial at Mt. Eden Cemetery in Hayward.

In lieu of flowers, the flowers, the family requests that donations be made to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, P.O. Box 1893, Memphis, TN, 38101, or to the charity of your choice.

LORETTA MARY FAHEY WENNERSTROM

March 26, 1924 – March 11, 2008

Died in Oakland, beloved wife of Justin for 50 years. Dear sister of John Emmett Fahey and the late James, Margaret and Barbara Fahey. Loving aunt of many nieces and nephews. Dear cousin of Mourine Henno. A native of Oakland for 83 years.

Visitation Thursday, March 13, 2008 from 2:00 – 6:00 pm at Holy Angels Funeral Center/Coopers Chapel, 1580 Fruitvale Ave., Oakland, CA.

Family and friends are invited to attend the funeral liturgy, Friday, March 14th at Our Lady of Lourdes Church at 1:00 pm. Interment immediately following at Holy Sepulchre Cemetery, Hayward, CA.

Memorial contributions to the St. Vincent de Paul Society preferred. Holy Angels Funeral & Cremation Center/Coopers Chapel. (510) 533-4115.

WILLIAM S. WOOD, SR.

DECEMBER 28, 1927

MARCH 5, 2008

William S. Wood, Sr., retired Assistant Fire Chief of the Hayward Fire Department, passed away on March 5, 2008. He was 80 years old. He was a native of Denver, Colorado and lived in Hayward for 61 years. He served in the U.S. Navy from 1/14/1946 to 11/10/1947. After being honorably discharged from the service he settled in Hayward. Bill met the love of his life Betty Leedom and they married on 9/1/1950. They were married for 46 years until she passed away on March 18, 1997. Bill served with the Hayward Fire Department for 32 years, obtaining the rank of Assistant Fire Chief. He also served as the acting Fire Chief before his retirement for 18 months. Bill was preceded in death by his wife Betty, brothers Jim, Lee and Richard and stepdaughter Vickie Ann. Bill is survived by his loving family: daughter Joan Estey and son William S. Wood Jr., son-in-law Stephen Estey, daughter-in-law Debra Wood, granddaughter Kelly Bush, grandson Steve Estey, great grandsons Waylon and Andrew, sister-in-laws Bernice Wood and Barbara Magni, brother-in-law Rufus Stombaugh as well as numerous nieces and nephews. Bill was a member of V.F.W. Post #1882 and was a life member of the International Association of Fire Chiefs, life member of the Western Fire Chiefs Association, past president of the Alameda County Training Officer’s Association, member of the Alameda County Veteran Fireman’s Association, Hayward Fire Folks Association and R.E.P.A. Retired State Employee’s Association. Bill will be lovingly missed by his family and friends, his longtime buddies Melvin Durham and Mernie Burkenbine and all his “fire folks” family. Bill touched the hearts of so many people in his lifetime, he will never be forgotten. Bill’s wishes are that in lieu of flowers, donations be sent to the Alameda County Cancer Society on behalf of his wife Betty. May he rest in peace.

Visitation will be at Holy Angels Sorensen Chapel, 1140 B St., Hayward, Saturday March 15, 2008 from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon followed by the Funeral Service at 12:00 noon. Interment will follow at Lone Tree Cemetery. HOLY ANGELS SORENSEN CHAPEL

510-581-1234 OR 510-351-1451

ALTON ROOSEVELT LARRY

Of Fremont, entered into rest on March 8, 2008 at the age of 71. Loving husband of 35 years to Mary L. Larry of Fremont. Beloved father to Richard, David, Kelvin, and Marlin. Proud grandfather to 11 grandchildren. Cherished brother to Iola Bodden, of Inglewood, Dorothy Brandon of Los Angeles, Joe Larry of Riverside, and Otis Larry of Alabama. Also survived by many nieces and nephews. Predeceased by sisters Lula Washington, and Willie M. Tucker.

Born December 12, 1936 in Adger, Alabama, he was a longtime resident of East Palo Alto.

A Memorial Service for Alton will be celebrated on Saturday, March 15, 1:00pm at Second Baptist Church, 1327 Hancock St., Redwood City, 94063.
